User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user account in the BukuCatatan application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

Note.title: Note
Note.description: Represents a single note created by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Note entity.

ownerId.description: The ID of the user who created and owns the note.

content.description: The rich text content of the note.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the note was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the note was last updated.

pinned.description: Whether the note is pinned to the top.

status.description: The status of the note, e.g., active or trashed.

permissions.description: A map of user IDs to their roles (e.g., 'owner', 'editor'). Governs access control.

_canAccess.description: An array of user IDs that have any level of access. Used for efficient querying.

Category.title: Category
Category.description: Represents a category for organizing notes.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Category entity.

parentId.description: The ID of the parent category, for creating a hierarchy. Optional.

Tag.title: Tag
Tag.description: Represents a tag for labeling notes.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Tag entity.

SharedNote.title: SharedNote
SharedNote.description: Represents a one-time shareable link for a note.

id.description: Unique identifier for the shared link.

userId.description: The ID of the user who owns the note.

noteId.description: The ID of the note being shared.

isUsed.description: Whether the link has been used.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the link was created.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed for a collaborative, multi-user application. It balances user-siloed data with shared data to support both private and collaborative features.

*   **Users Collection:** Stores user profiles, remaining private to each user.
*   **User-Owned Data (Categories, Tags):** Categories and Tags remain within user-specific subcollections (`/users/{userId}/...`). This maintains privacy and simplifies security for personal organization tools.
*   **Notes Collection:** Notes are now in a root-level `notes` collection to facilitate sharing and collaboration. This is a critical shift from the user-siloed model. Access control is no longer based on the path, but on a `permissions` map and an `_canAccess` array within each note document. This allows multiple users to be granted different levels of access (owner, editor, viewer) to the same note.
*   **Shared Notes Collection:** The `sharedNotes` collection remains at the root for public, one-time sharing links, with creation still restricted to the note's owner.

This hybrid model—combining path-based ownership for purely private data and document-based permissions for collaborative data—provides a scalable and secure foundation. List operations on notes are secured by enforcing a query constraint on the `_canAccess` field, ensuring users can only fetch notes they are explicitly permitted to see.
